meanings.definition: The upward growth of plant organs in response to external stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The epinasties of the plant leaves helped them reach towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The epinasties of the tree branches allowed them to grow taller and stronger.
meanings.sent3: The epinasties of the flowers made them look like they were dancing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The epinasties of the vines reached out eagerly for support, like seeking a helping hand.
meanings.sent5: The epinasties of the plant were like nature's way of giving it a boost towards the sky.

meanings.definition: The bending or curving of plant parts in a downward direction.
meanings.sent1: The epinasties of the leaves caused them to droop sadly towards the ground.
meanings.sent2: The epinasties of the stems made the plant look like it was bowing in humility.
meanings.sent3: The epinasties of the branches seemed to be playing a game of limbo with the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The epinasties of the petals gave the impression of a graceful bow in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The epinasties of the vine's tendrils reached down as if trying to touch the earth below.
